detailed_guest_info: The podcast guest is discussing the concept of Frequency-hopping spread spectrum (FHSS). FHSS is a method of transmitting radio signals by rapidly changing the carrier frequency among multiple frequencies within a large spectral band. It is used to avoid interference, prevent eavesdropping, enable code-division multiple access (CDMA) communications, and allows for sharing a frequency band with minimal mutual interference.

podcast_details.title: Conan O’Brien Needs A Friend
podcast_details.subtitle: After 25 years at the Late Night desk, Conan realized that the only people at his holiday party are the men and women who work for him. Over the years and despite thousands of interviews, Conan has never made a real and lasting friendship with any of his celebrity guests. So, he started a podcast to do just that. Deeper, unboundedly playful, and free from FCC regulations, Conan O’Brien Needs a Friend is a weekly opportunity for Conan to hang out with the people he enjoys most and perhaps find some real friendship along the way.

podcast_summary:
- TL;DR: In this episode, Conan, Sonam, and Matt are joined by Sarah Lund, who creates pizza art using various toppings.
- Sarah creates pizza art featuring Conan, Matt, and Sona using hummus, cheese, scallions, and more.
- The pizzas are put in the oven, and the results will be revealed in the next episode.
- Conan reminisces about his high school track days and his decision to prioritize his mind over athleticism.
- Stay tuned for the next episode to find out how the pizzas turn out and for a special dessert treat.

Chapter 1: The Missing Glasses

Chapter 2: Summer Chores with Conan and the Chill Chums

Chapter 3: The Investigation

Chapter 4: Pizza Art and Solo Stove

Chapter 5: Cooking the Pizza Art

Chapter 6: The Finale and Teaser for Next Episode
